panels.description:
UDP packet rate handled by all QUIC tiles.
Positive numbers indicate incoming packets (RX), negative numbers indicate outgoing packets (TX)
panels.title: QUIC packets

panels.description:
UDP line rate received and sent by all QUIC tiles. 
This includes network headers (Ethernet, IPv4, UDP header, QUIC header, QUIC payload)
panels.title: QUIC bandwidth

panels.description: Transaction count received in the current interval
panels.title: QUIC Txns Recvd

panels.description: Transaction count failed in QUIC stream handling code (abandoned, too large, overrun). Not counting small streams
panels.title: QUIC Txns Failed

panels.description: Ratio of streams received vs streams started
panels.title: Stream Complete Rate

panels.description: Sum of QUIC connection counts across all QUIC tiles
panels.title: QUIC conns

panels.description: Cumulative number of connections created in the current Grafana time range
panels.title: QUIC Conns Created

panels.description:
Number of frames per second for each QUIC frame type.

'stream' frames carry Solana transactions. 
'ping' frames do keep-alive to avoid connection timeouts.
Everything else is metadata.

Use shift+left click to hide certain frame types.
panels.title: Received Frames

panels.description:
Cumulative number of connections killed by QUIC tiles, in the current Grafana time range.

Typical reasons include:
- TLS handshake failure
- Internal allocation failure

Does not include timeouts
panels.title: QUIC Conns Aborted

panels.description: Cumulative number of connections gracefully closed. AKA normal client disconnects.
panels.title: QUIC Conns Gracef. Closed

panels.description:
QUIC stream events per second
(Each QUIC stream corresponds to one Solana transaction)

- QUIC Unfragmented Rcvd: Peer sent an entire transaction in one QUIC frame
- QUIC Fragmented Rcvd: Peer sent a transaction fragment
- QUIC Abandoned: Txn dropped because the connection closed
- QUIC Overrun: Reassembly operation dropped because lack of buffer space
- QUIC Txn Undersz: Stream fully received but it's smaller than the smallest valid transaction. Some clients abuse undersize streams as a ping mechanism but this is harmless to Firedancer
- QUIC Txn Oversz: Stream byte received that is beyond the transaction MTU
- UDP Rcvd: Peer sent an entire transaction in one UDP packet
- UDP Undersz: UDP packet too small
- UDP Oversz: UDP packet too large
panels.title: TPU Transaction Rate

panels.description:
Handshake events per second

- Alloc Fail: Handshake object pool is full (indicates connection attempt spam) 
- Created: Handshake object allocated
panels.title: QUIC Handshake Pool

panels.description:
Connections rejected per second

- Alloc Fail: Aborted because the connection table was full
- TLS Fail: Aborted because the TLS 1.3 handshake failed
- Retry Fail: Client send an expired or invalid retry token (QUIC Retry are comparable to TCP SYN cookies)
panels.title: QUIC Conn Rejects

panels.description:
Connection events per second.

- Created: Connection objects created (tracked before the handshake succeeds)
- Aborted: Connections killed by the validator
- Graceful Closed: Connections gracefully closed by the peer
- Timeout: Connections garbage-collected by the validator because no data was seen for the duration of the idle timeout
panels.title: QUIC Conn Churn

panels.description: Number of packets dropped in the current Grafana time interval
panels.title: Dropped Packets
